tool.title: Gaussian process
tool.about: This tool takes samples from a Gaussian process, given a covriance kernel or an exponential covariance matrix given the lengthscale, signal strength and noise variance.

about.label: Introduction
about.description: Gives the user the possibility to see a set of instructions before using the tool.

about.label: Parameters
about.description: Please enter the desired parameters for the simulation in here.

about.label: Manual input
about.description: Choose between entering the covariance kernel manually or have it calculated according to the exponential covariance formula.

about.label: Number of samples
about.description: The number of samples to take from the gaussian process.

about.label: 3-D
about.description: Allows you to choose between a two dimensional output and a three dimensional output.

about.label: Min x
about.description: The minimum value for your x axis.

about.label: Min y
about.description: The minimum value for your y axis.

about.label: Max x
about.description: The maximum value for your x axis.

about.label: Max y
about.description: The maximum value for your y axis.

about.label: Lengthscale
about.description: This parameter is used to calculate the covariance matrix according to the exponential covariance formula.

about.label: Signal strength
about.description: This parameter is used to calculate the covariance matrix according to the exponential formula.

about.label: Noise variance
about.description: It stabilizes the Cholesky decomposition of the covariance matirx. It is the noise of the process.

about.label: Functions from the Gaussian process
about.description: The two dimensional functions sampled from the Gaussian process.
